Both of these most likely are not true. I don't know off hand if any of the std lib is using anything like a section writer. How many would benefit is probably somewhere between some and a few due to writing multiple sections of a file concurrently being a fairly limited use case. Symmetry with Section Reader is probably the strongest case in this situation.

Off hand the obvious use cases would be writing sections of a file concurrently from a download such as byte rage file from a network, or something similar to a torrent.

The code being written already or not I'm not sure has a big impact, but understand not wanting to have outstanding issues that potentially never get fulfilled.
